intro: Cyperus atronervatus subsp. angustifolius, commonly known as narrow-leaved sedgeland sedge, is a flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and compact, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats, such as marshes and wetlands. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinct midrib, contributing to its botanical identification. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
